ResponseText: i could say something rude, but i wont.

In the 1920's Here in the United States we had Some Christian Fundamentalist Movements that insisted on a literalist interpretation of the "Genesis Creation Narrative" and likewise opposed the Idea of Human Evolution. These groups succeeded in getting the teaching of Evolution banned in the United States public Schools. In the Mid 1960's a group calling themselves" Young Earth Creationists" began promoting the teaching of what they called " Scientific Creationism" using Flood Geology in public school science classes to support a purely literal reading of the Genesis account. Now here is where it gets Dicey.. In the Case of Daniel vs. Waters (1975) the Judge ruled that teaching creationism in public schools contravened the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment and the content of public schools teachings was subsequently stripped of overt biblical references and renamed " Creation Science" .. Then in the case of Edwards vs. Aguillard (1987) the court ruled that creation science similarly contravened the Constitution and all references to " Creation" in school textbooks were changed to refer to " Intelligent Design . These Creationists then took the term" Intelligent Design" and once again re-named themselves. They began claiming Intelligent Design to be a " New" Scientific Theory and began again an attempt to introduce " Creation" into our schools by masking it under Intelligent Design. another case.. The case of Kitzmiller vs. Dover ( 2005) the Court Ruled that Intelligent Design is NOT science, and contravenes the constitutional restriction on teaching religion in Public School Classes. Yet you are not a Creationist... You have asked me to rescind my statement where I called you a Creationist. I have replied that I Will Not.. You can continue to change the term or whatever you wish, but a black kettle is black, a blue sky is blue , and a Creationist no matter what you want to call it is a Creationist. Currently the debate in this specific Topic is Creationism vs. Evolution. If you do not support one then by default you support the other. Call yourself God, it doesn't matter because at the end of the day if your position is that along the line somewhere there is a Creator involved then you are a Creationist. And why worry over me calling you a Creationist?.. I'm just one Person among many who formed my opinion based on the evidence presented in this thread.
